message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC 

This paper discusses the theoretical foundations of large-scale sensor networks, which involves issues related to network connectivity, capacity, clocks, and function computation. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also addresses fundamental bounds and algorithms, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also discusses clock synchronization and function computation, which could place it in cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), respectively.
